intro: Manihot microdendron, commonly known as the small-leaf cassava, is a shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a starchy root that is used as a food source in some regions. It is adapted to tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential agricultural uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
